Janet - Teacher of London Taxi Drivers
I work with students who want to become taxi drivers. I help them learn the routes in London. They practice finding the best way to get from one place to another. I help them when they disagree about the best route. When they are close to the test, I give them a new route and they have to find another way. This helps them think.
Sarah - Marine Conservationist
I work from home and help people learn about the ocean. I answer phone calls, make educational materials, and organize courses. Sometimes I go to our main office. I also work with schools and teach people who make decisions about the sea. I take them on boat trips to help them understand the ocean better. I love my job because I love the ocean, but sometimes we don't have enough money.
Chris - Map and Atlas Publisher
I work on making maps and atlases. I make sure we publish the right books and have enough copies. We get many letters from readers who want to change something. I talk to other publishers about our projects and sales. I work with a happy team, but sometimes there is too much paperwork and not enough time for the fun parts of the job.

We always go to Ireland in June. For many years, we've spent the first two weeks of the month at a big house called Glencorn Lodge in County Antrim. The house is near the sea and a small village called Ardbeag. A friend, Strafe, found the house for us. He saw an advertisement and showed it to us. We didn't like our previous holiday because the food was bad.
The four of us have been friends for a long time. Our names are Dekko, Strafe, Cynthia, and I (my name is Milly, but most people call me that). We all live near each other and are around the same age.
When we arrived at Glencorn Lodge, Mrs. Malseed was waiting for us in the big hall. She always knows when we're coming. She showed us to our rooms, which have flower names like Rose, Tulip, Lily, and Geranium. Mr. Malseed, her husband, welcomed us with a big smile and said "A hundred thousand welcomes" in the Irish way.
We felt happy and relaxed. We knew that our holiday had started well. After dinner, we played cards for a bit, but then went to bed because we were tired from our journey. The next day, we would walk along the beach, have coffee in the village, and then go on a trip somewhere. This is what we usually do when we're at Glencorn Lodge.
I hope you like this simplified text!

Sarah is a 24-year-old from West Sussex who works as a chalet girl in Val d'Isere, France. She cooks and cleans for visitors who come to ski and stay in wooden houses called chalets. Sarah loves her job because she meets new people every week. She wakes up at 7am and walks to the chalet, where she makes breakfast for the guests. They like to have porridge, eggs, cereals, fruit, and croissants.
After breakfast, Sarah cleans the rooms or makes tea for the guests. She then goes skiing until 4:30pm. After dinner, she helps with the dishes and sometimes chats with the guests. Sarah likes to stay out with her friends until 11pm, but not on Sundays because she has to work early in the morning.
On Sundays, Sarah helps the guests who are leaving and then cleans the chalet. She does the shopping and prepares tea for the new guests who arrive at 4:30pm. Sarah takes the guests to the ski shop and helps them with their equipment. She then has dinner and sometimes relaxes with a drink or goes to bed early if she's tired.

Miss Rita Cohen, a small, pale girl, came to Seymour's factory one day. She wore overalls and big shoes and had curly hair. She was very young, but she was studying at the University of Pennsylvania to get a Master's degree. Seymour sometimes helped students who wanted to learn about his factory. Rita was very curious and asked many questions. She wanted to know about the leather industry in New Jersey. Seymour showed her around the factory and told her about the process of making gloves. He also offered to take her to the tannery, where they make the leather. Rita was interested in everything and wrote down all the details. Seymour liked her enthusiasm. She reminded him of his daughter Marie, who loved to learn and remember everything. Seymour offered to make a pair of gloves with Rita and let her watch the whole process from start to finish. He asked her what size she wore.

Chris Arnot talks to four people who have their dream jobs. They tell him if their jobs are as wonderful as they seem.
A. Raquel Graham is a personal assistant to a pop star. She travels a lot and has to deal with a lot of paperwork. She doesn't like flying, but she loves her job. She didn't choose this job, but she got it because she met the pop star's manager.
B. David Brown used to be an accountant and a golf caddy. He liked being a caddy more because he loves golf. He helped golfers by giving them advice and reading the course. Now, he works for the European Tour Productions, making statistics for golf tournaments.
C. Martin Fern is the editor of the food pages in a newspaper. He gets to try new restaurants and write about them. He thinks it's okay if some restaurants are expensive because they're special. He used to work in advertising, but he loves his job now.
D. Dick Prince is a children's writer. He started writing stories 20 years ago. He writes about things he knows, like farming. He likes writing and gets many letters from readers. He answers all of them, but now he has some help from a secretary.

There was an old building in a lumberyard by a lake. The building was two stories high and surrounded by big piles of soft sawdust. One afternoon, some friends were bored and decided to go up to the roof. Michael, one of the friends, said, 'I dare you to jump down!' He jumped first and rolled around in the sawdust, laughing. The others were hesitant, but eventually they all jumped too.
After a while, they decided to do it again. But Michael was the only one left on the roof. He was scared, but he didn't want to admit it. He was thinking about jumping, but he couldn't do it. His friends were getting impatient and started to leave. Michael stayed on the roof for a long time, feeling sad and ashamed.
Eventually, he jumped down and lay in the sawdust for a while. When he got up, he went home. His stepmother was upset because he was late for dinner. She told him he was old enough to get home on time, and if he didn't, he should stay in. Michael was still feeling sad and didn't want to talk to anyone.

**Changing Your Job**
Are you not happy in your job? Do you want to change, but don't know how? You can talk to a careers adviser. They will ask you about your past and then give you some tests. The tests are like a quiz. They will tell you what jobs you might be good at and what skills you need to learn.
I went to a place called Career Analysts. I took the tests with a group of people. We had to answer questions quickly. It was like being in school again! I had to remember that it wasn't about passing or failing. The tests were hard, but they helped me understand myself better.
Then, I talked to an adviser. They looked at my results and told me what they thought I was good at and what jobs I might like. I was happy with most of what they said, but I was surprised that I didn't do well in some areas. I was glad to know that I made good choices about being a journalist.
You don't have to change your job completely. Donna Laney, a 25-year-old woman, lost her job as a marketing manager. She went to Career Analysts to help her figure out what to do next. She discovered that she had a talent for design. She decided to use her existing skills and move to a new job in public relations.
Other people have also found help at Career Analysts. Juliet Greene, a 26-year-old woman, was unhappy in her job at a bank. She went to Career Counselling Services and discovered that she was interested in science. She decided to start a degree course in geology.
Not everyone finds careers advice helpful. Amanda Margetts, a 24-year-old sales representative, didn't find it useful. She didn't like the suggestions because they required a lot of changes or a lower salary.
Remember, careers advice is not the same for everyone. You have to be open-minded and willing to listen to new ideas.

'Is the Dentist a Fun Place? When you visit W. Lloyd Jerome's dental surgery in Glasgow, you'll see nice paintings on the walls and a blue couch where patients sit while he checks their teeth. Jerome says many people only go to the dentist when they have a problem, not for regular check-ups. This is because they are scared. He wants to make people feel comfortable, so he doesn't wear a white coat. He thinks that makes people feel less scared. Jerome wants his patients to feel relaxed, interested, and happy. He even uses special machines that make you feel like you're watching a movie while he checks your teeth. The surgery smells nice, like a perfume shop, not like a dentist's office. Jerome is a serious dentist, but he also wants his patients to feel comfortable. He uses special tools to clean your teeth, and it doesn't hurt if you're relaxed. Jerome went to the United States to learn new techniques and found that making patients feel comfortable makes it easier for the dentist too. He wants to make dentistry a more friendly and relaxing experience for everyone.'

Chocolate is a popular food all around the world. It started in South America a long time ago. In the UK, people buy a lot of chocolate at Easter. In fact, they spend over £230 million on it! Only at Christmas do people eat more chocolate.
The cacao tree is a special plant that grows in many warm places. The fruit of the tree has 20-40 seeds inside. When the seeds are dried, they become cacao beans. These beans are used to make chocolate.
A long time ago, the Aztecs used cacao beans as money and to make a special drink called xocoatl. This drink was bitter and was often flavored with spices. The Spanish people liked it better when it was mixed with cinnamon and sugar.
In the 17th century, chocolate houses were popular in Europe. People would gather to drink chocolate. Later, a man from the Netherlands invented chocolate powder. This made it easier to make chocolate.
In the 19th century, a company in England called Fry and Sons created a solid chocolate bar. Then, a Swiss company added milk to the chocolate, making milk chocolate.
Now, many companies make chocolate bars. Some companies are trying new things, like making chocolate ice cream or chocolate soft drinks. But some cacao farmers are still struggling because the price of cacao beans went down a long time ago.
Next time you eat a chocolate bar, remember the people who grow the cacao beans.

Peter Cooke is 83 years old and is very good at making things from shells. He has been doing this for 10 years and loves it. He shows me his work in his apartment and is very enthusiastic about it. He makes all sorts of things, like ornaments and flowers, using shells and other materials. Some of his friends thought he should have an exhibition to show his work, and it was a big success. People like his work very much and are willing to pay a lot of money for it.
Peter says he doesn't care if people don't buy his work, because he loves making it. He has his own special way of doing things and uses materials like cardboard, glue, and soap to make his creations. He travels to different beaches to find the most beautiful shells and only collects dead shells. He doesn't want to hurt the environment or disturb the living creatures in the shells.
Peter wishes he had started making things from shells earlier in his life, but he is still happy to be doing it now. He says that his work is a way for him to express himself and be creative.

Kira Langer is a 15-year-old girl who is a model. When she's not working, she's in school. She's very good at her job and has been on the covers of many magazines. I went to interview her at a modeling agency. When she arrived, she was with her mother. Kira wasn't dressed in fancy clothes, but in a simple black dress and trainers. She seemed very friendly and normal.
Kira's mother always goes with her to work because she's under 16. Kira's sister encouraged her to enter a model competition, and she won. Now she works for a big modeling agency in London. Kira has to balance her school life and her modeling career. Some people at school are mean to her because she's a model, but her friends are nice about it. They understand that she can't always make plans because she might get a job call at the last minute.
Kira is very good at her job and has a bright future ahead of her. She's still in school, but she's already doing very well. If she didn't want to be a model, she would like to be a journalist like me.

Terence and Chris Madden, a father and son, are searching for gold in Wales. They have been digging for 10 years and think they are close to finding a big amount of gold. They believe their mine could have up to 10,000 ounces of gold. They have been digging in the Welsh hills and are finding high levels of gold.
The father and son team have been searching for gold for a long time. They started after the father read about gold in an old book. They chose a special area to dig and have been working hard to get permission to dig. They have spent their savings to make a tunnel and a deep hole.
Now, they need more money to dig a little deeper to find the gold. They are trying to find someone to give them £50,000 to help them. Chris Madden says it's not sure if they will find someone, but they have some people they can ask.
The news about the gold has made some people in the town excited. The town relies on tourists, and people are hoping that if they find gold, more people will come to visit. But some people are worried that if they find gold, many people might come and damage the hillside.
Wales used to have many gold mines, but most of them closed a long time ago. Now, some people are starting to dig again. George Hall is another prospector who is searching for gold. He says it's exciting to search for gold and maybe he will be lucky and find some.

Rachel Mills is a scientist who loves to spend time underwater. She studies the chemistry of the sea and teaches at the Oceanography Centre at Southampton University. When she's not teaching, she goes on a special vehicle to the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean to explore underwater volcanoes. These volcanoes are called "black smokers" because hot water comes out of the rock and looks like black smoke.
The vehicle is small and has two pilots inside. They have to stay there for 16 hours, collecting samples of rock and water. If something goes wrong, they can press a button to get out quickly. The escape vessel goes up to the surface fast, like a ping-pong ball in a bath.
Rachel has gone on six dives so far. She went to a place in the Atlantic Ocean with a Russian team to study a huge area of underwater volcanoes. They were trying to make a hole in a volcano to see what happens.
When Rachel is not at sea, she works in her office at the Oceanography Centre. She teaches and does research to learn more about the black smokers. She loves her job because it's an adventure. She feels happy and amazed when she looks out of the window and sees the volcanoes.

I was tired, dirty, and hungry after my Inter-Rail holiday. My body was tired and my mind was confused from all the new languages, timetables, and currencies. I said I would never go again, but the next year I did the same thing. With an Inter-Rail ticket, I could travel anywhere in Europe for a month. I didn't need to buy a lot of things, so I didn't waste a lot. This way of traveling is fun and easy.
My friends and I didn't know what to do at first, but we soon discovered that we could travel to many countries. We didn't plan to see all the famous sights, but we enjoyed the journey. We liked to explore new places and see the differences between cities. Seeing Europe with my own eyes was amazing. It's one thing to know about a place, but it's different when you see it for yourself.
The train trip was a great experience for me. I learned to appreciate the differences between countries and cultures. It's a big world, and Inter-Rail helped me understand that.

Losing your luggage at the airport is a frustrating experience. You might have to wear the same clothes for a long time until the airline finds your bag. This can happen even if you're in a different country with different weather. Airlines don't often tell us how many bags they lose, but it's a common problem.
Even good airlines make mistakes sometimes. It's hard to guarantee that your luggage will be on the same flight, especially if you have a layover. Airlines have rules to make sure bags get on the right planes, but sometimes things go wrong.
At big airports, it's easy for bags to get mixed up. Last year, over 41 million people passed through London's Heathrow airport, and many of them were changing planes. Even small airports can have problems too.
If you're changing planes, try to choose a direct flight or check in early. If you have to change planes, try to fly with the same airline and leave extra time between flights. Make sure to label your luggage inside and out with your name and address. If your luggage still goes missing, tell the airline official at the baggage claim and fill out a special form before you leave the airport.

Charlie James is a wildlife photographer who loves taking pictures of kingfishers. Kingfishers are small, blue-green birds that live near streams and rivers and eat fish. They are very beautiful and can be hard to spot because they are shy. Charlie started taking pictures of kingfishers when he was young. He loves the way they look and the way they move. He thinks they are very special.
Kingfishers have special feathers that make them look blue, but they don't actually have blue pigment. Instead, the way the light hits their feathers makes them look blue. This is why they can look different colors depending on the light. Charlie loves the colors of the kingfisher and the way they change.
Charlie has spent a lot of time watching kingfishers and taking pictures of them. He has even missed school to be with them. He loves them so much that he wants to make a film about them. He wants the film to be just pictures, no words, because he thinks that's the best way to show how beautiful they are.
Charlie is very good at taking pictures of kingfishers and has even worked as a photographer for a nature magazine. He wants to make the best kingfisher film ever and show people how amazing they are.

**Conductors Talk**
Conducting an orchestra is not easy. Five conductors share their stories.
A. ANNE MANSON
Anne Manson, 30, was asked to help a famous conductor, Claudio Abbado, in Vienna. She stood in for his assistant and then helped on another opera. "I wasn't nervous. I'm used to standing in front of an orchestra."
Anne works with a big opera company in London and travels to other countries with help from the British Arts Council.
B. ANDREW CONSTANTINE
Andrew Constantine, 31, won a big competition in 1991. He was grateful for the chance to perform and work with a famous conductor. But he worries that people still think of him as a competition winner. "If I'm still known for that in three years, I'll be worried."
Andrew now works with a well-known orchestra and is invited back to conduct again.
C. WASFI KANI
Wasfi Kani, who started her own opera company, loves the long practice period before a show. "The music is worth four weeks of practice." She started conducting in her late 20s and learned from a good teacher.
D. ROGER VIGNOLES
Roger Vignoles, 48, didn't plan to be a conductor. He used to play music with an opera house and learned from good conductors. Last year, he directed a famous opera from the piano. "It was easier than I thought. I knew the music and got the performance I wanted."
E. WAYNE MARSHALL
Wayne Marshall, 32, started conducting by accident. He was asked to conduct a musical in London at short notice. He even had to deal with musicians who were not paying attention. "I was firm with them. I gave a clear beat and got a good result." Wayne never studied conducting, but people have been kind to him. He knows what he likes and is determined to do well.

"Theme Parks in Britain
We asked five families to visit different theme parks in Britain. We wanted to know which one is the best for families with children.
Fun Island was a surprise. We thought it would be boring compared to a big theme park in the US, but it was fun! The park has many rides for young children, so our three-year-old had a great time. The kids loved the Crocodile Ride and the Big Wheel. There's a special ride for little kids, and older kids can go on scarier rides like Splash Out. The staff were very helpful and the park was clean and well-organized.
Wonderland was great for our family. None of us had been to a theme park before, so we didn't know what to expect. Our little boy, Oscar, loved the Mountain Train and Little Land, where he could play with small buildings. The older kids enjoyed the Ferris wheel and driving toy cars. We liked that there were places to rest and the staff were friendly.
Adventure World was a lot of fun. We spent seven hours there and still didn't see everything. The kids loved the Big Top Circus and the Terror Line. There's a special area for younger children, Toy Land, and a new ride called Fear Factor, but it was too scary for our kids. The park was very well designed and clean.
The Great Park was good for younger children because the rides weren't too scary. We all enjoyed Exotic Travels, a boat ride that starts slow and then gets exciting. We also liked Lightning River, but it was over too soon. If you're brave, you might like the Big Leap, but I was too scared!
Fantasy World was a lot of fun. There are many rides, including Europe's tallest roller-coaster. The kids loved it, but some of the staff were not very friendly. We needed a full day to see everything and wouldn't have wanted to leave early."

'Running a business in the countryside
Five women talk about their experiences setting up a business in the countryside.
Christine Hogan runs a computer-aided design business from her home. She moved to the countryside to be with her family and wanted to work from home. She has four employees and makes over £200,000 a year. She likes being able to work in the evenings if she wants to.
Maggy Sasanow is a designer who works from home. She used to work in a museum, but moved to the countryside and started her own business making greeting cards. She sells them to museums and works in a big room upstairs. She likes being independent, but sometimes misses working with others.
Delia Turner makes curtains from her home. She started her business eight years ago and it was very successful, but then the economy went down and she had to lay off her employees. Now she works with her husband and some part-time helpers. She has to be careful with her prices and look for new opportunities.
Tessa Strickland runs a children's book publishing business from her farmhouse. She moved to the countryside for financial reasons and to be closer to nature. She works with authors and artists from all over the world and has to be disciplined to shut her office door.
Meg Rivers runs a cakes-by-post business and a shop. She started making cakes at home and soon got requests from friends and family. She now employs six people and makes £250,000 a year. Her biggest problem is the financial side of the business.'

Meet the Watkins Family
The Watkins family is very special. The two sons, Paul and Huw, are musicians. Their dad, John, makes instruments. This is not common. Usually, you find musicians who play instruments, but it's rare to find someone who makes them too.
When Paul was 10 years old, he wanted to play the cello. His parents, John and Hetty, looked for a cello, but it was very expensive. So, John thought, "Why not make one myself?" He took evening classes to learn how to make instruments. He made Paul's first cello, and it turned out well. Later, he made another one for Paul.
John now makes instruments full-time. He makes violins and sells them. One day, he even sold one to a famous musician. Paul and Huw started playing music when they were young. Paul started with the piano, and then he liked the cello better. Huw started with the piano too, but he liked it more. He didn't want to play the violin like his brother Paul.
Paul and Huw's parents were very supportive. They let them choose what they wanted to play. Paul is now 28 and plays the cello in a big orchestra. He won a big competition and became famous. Huw is 22 and writes music. He will play his music in a big concert hall soon.
The family is very busy with music. They have to keep track of each other's concerts and performances.

The National Trust helps take care of the countryside in Britain. I visited the Lleyn Peninsula in North Wales and met Gareth, a warden who works for the Trust. He told me that to be a good warden, you need to use your common sense and be good with people.
Gareth grew up on a farm in the area and used to work with his parents. He got the job as a warden because of his local knowledge and farming experience. He didn't need special training.
Gareth likes that he can still work on his parents' farm and understand the problems of local farmers. He also knows how to do physical jobs like building fences and planting trees. Since he started working for the Trust, Gareth has learned more about nature conservation.
He used to collect flowers, butterfly larvae, and old birds' nests when he was a child. Now he realizes that farming has changed the countryside. He says that farmers and conservationists used to argue, but now they are working together.
Gareth's job is to make sure projects are finished quickly and at a low cost. He enjoys seeing projects finished, but sometimes he has to do paperwork and deal with difficult people. He likes his job, but sometimes it's hard to be nice to everyone.
If you like the outdoors and have common sense, you might want to apply to be a warden like Gareth. But there might not be a job available on the Lleyn Peninsula for a long time.

Meet Kendra Slowinski, the captain of England's netball team. She's been preparing for the World Championships, which will take place next month. Kendra's days are busy - she teaches at a local school and then trains in a car park. She's very focused on her training and doesn't notice people watching her.
Kendra's goal is to be the best she can be for the Championships. She has a strict schedule to get fit for the big event. This is her fourth World Championships, and it will be the biggest one yet with 27 teams taking part.
Kendra is excited to have the support of the home crowd. She thinks it will be special to play in front of them. She also wants to improve the reputation of netball in England. The team is ranked fourth in the world, but Kendra knows it will be tough. She says that every day is a challenge, and they have to be ready to play their best.
Kendra has been playing netball for 15 years, and the sport has become harder and faster. Players are more aggressive now. But Kendra says that after the game, they are all friends again.
Kendra is also working on her fitness and mental attitude. She wants to be a good example for her teammates. She has planned her netball career carefully and knows that this will be her last big event. She might even coach young players in the future, but for now, she's focusing on the World Championships.

**Special Music Schools**
If your child is very good at music, it's not always easy to know how to help them develop their talent. Some parents might not notice their child's gift until they start to get frustrated or behave badly. Schools are usually good at helping children who are very good at other subjects, but music schools are special because they understand children who are very talented in music.
There are five special music schools in Britain. They are for children aged 7-18 who want to learn music with professional musicians. At these schools, children spend most of their day doing music activities like playing instruments, singing, and practicing with teachers. They also have some time for regular school subjects like English, maths, and languages.
The schools are small and have a high teacher-to-student ratio. Most students live at the school, which means they can focus on their music and make friends with other children who love music.
However, there are some downsides. The schools are expensive, with fees ranging from £12,000 to £17,000 per year. Some parents might not want their children to go to boarding school, especially when they are very young. The schools also worry about the pressure on children who are very talented and might feel stressed or unhappy.
Some people think it's better to wait until children are a bit older before sending them to a special music school. This way, they can make their own decisions about their education. Others might do well in a regular school with a good music department or by taking music lessons on Saturdays.
But for families who live far from big cities, this might not be an option.

Susan Shepherd is a famous artist who loves to paint flowers. Her garden is full of her favorite flowers, like tulips and poppies. Some of the plants are a bit wild and spread themselves around the garden. The garden has two long flower borders that are very colorful and well-organized. This is because the previous owners of the house loved gardening and left many plants behind.
Susan likes to focus on painting individual flowers rather than the whole garden. She often picks a flower, takes it to her studio, and paints it. It can take her a few days or even a couple of years to finish a painting. Spring and early summer are her busiest times, when the tulips and poppies bloom.
Susan loves watching the flowers change over time. For example, she likes to put tulips in water and watch them change shape and color. She's always been interested in plants and used to collect wildflowers when she was a child. Now, she has a big garden with many plants from all around the world.
Susan doesn't mind if her garden gets a bit messy. She just wants to make sure it's not damaged. She has a lot of work to do right now, preparing for two art exhibitions, but she knows it's important to spend time in her garden to get inspiration for her paintings. She even has an extra gardener to help her now.

Sarah is a 24-year-old from England who works as a chalet girl in France. She cooks and cleans for visitors who come to ski and stay in wooden houses called chalets. Sarah loves her job because she meets new people every week. She gets up early to make breakfast for the guests, then cleans and prepares tea for them. She also skis as much as she can. Sarah works hard, but she likes her job.
Sarah's day starts at 7 am. She walks to the chalet and has her own breakfast before making breakfast for the guests. They have a lot of food to choose from, like porridge, eggs, and croissants. After breakfast, Sarah cleans up and gets ready for the day. She goes skiing until 4:30 pm, then comes back to the chalet to prepare dinner.
Sarah serves dinner at 8 pm and then clears up afterwards. She usually stays up late to chat with the guests or watch TV. On Sundays, Sarah works even earlier and has to clean the chalet quickly. She then prepares tea for the new guests and helps them with their ski equipment. Sarah likes her job and enjoys meeting new people, but sometimes she is very tired and goes to bed early.

'Meet Mandie, a zookeeper. She spent a day at a magazine office. She wore her uniform to work at the zoo, but at the magazine office, she wore different clothes. She saw a fashion shoot and thought about how different her job is from the zoo. She likes her job at the zoo and will stay there.
Alice, a fashion assistant, spent the day at the zoo. She wore her own clothes, but got a green shirt from the zoo. She got dirty and had a great time. She might like to work with elephants in the future.
Karen, a nurse, worked with a TV gardening show. She met the team and was excited. She liked being outside and working with plants. She was tired but had fun. She likes her job as a nurse and will keep doing it.
Charlie, a gardener, worked at a hospital. He made beds and gave medicine. He thought he would be tired, but he was okay. He liked the friendly nurses and felt happy.
Lucy, a personal trainer, worked as a flight attendant. She wore a special uniform and felt important. She gave out magazines and felt shy. On the way back, there were many noisy children. She liked her job as a personal trainer and will keep doing it.
Sonia, an air hostess, worked as a personal trainer. She didn't like exercise, but was surprised by how much attention each person gets. She saw that some trainers didn't eat healthy food, but drank a lot of water. She likes her job as an air hostess and won't change it. She might start going to the gym to be healthier.'

Five famous people tell us about their favorite train journeys. 
Andrea Thompson - Newsreader I love traveling to the south of France. There's a train that goes along the coast and into Italy. It's very beautiful. You can see the sea and the houses of rich people. The train is always full of happy people from different countries. They all love the journey.
Raj Patel - Explorer I have taken many train journeys, but my favorite is the Nile Valley Express in Sudan. When I was a child, I never got to go on a family train trip. I was too young and sent to live with an aunt. When I moved to England, I saw my first big train station in London. It was amazing!
Betty Cooper - Novelist I'm very grateful for one special train. It took me and my husband on our honeymoon to France and then to Egypt. On the train, my husband gave me a pink dress. I loved it! The journey was very relaxing. We traveled through France and then by boat up the Nile River.
Martin Brown - Journalist We were writing a series of articles about a trip around the world. We had to cross a desert in Africa, so we took the Desert Express. The train was late, and we didn't know when it would come. When it arrived, many people got on, even some who sat on the roof! At night, the train went through very beautiful landscapes. It was like a dream.
Arisu Mezuki - Actress I didn't grow up with trains like many people do. I saw very few trains in Singapore and Cyprus. But when I was a teenager, I made a film about a train in Yorkshire, England. I loved the old train and the people who took care of it. When I went back to the train station, everything was still the same, even the old gas lights.

Want to get published? Margaret Stubbs is here to help. Many readers write to us asking, "Where can I send my story?" The first thing they need to know is that they should research their markets and learn about publishers. Writing is a business, and you need to know what kind of writing is wanted. One way to do this is to read lots of books and magazines. Go to your local library and bookstore to see what's popular. This will help you know what kind of writing publishers are looking for.
When you start writing, it's a good idea to find out which magazines publish the kind of writing you want to do. For example, if you want to write love stories, find out which magazines publish them. Read recent copies and see what kind of stories they like. Understand who their readers are and what they want to read.
Some writers send me their work and ask if it's any good. I always try to be honest, but I also try to be kind. The problem is that many new writers send their work out too soon. It's not usually ready for publication. When you finally send your work, keep writing more stories while you wait for a reply. This will help you get better and more confident. Don't show your work to anyone else until you're sure it's ready. Every successful writer has had many rejections before they succeeded. To get better, take a writing course or join a writers' group. Think of yourself as a writer and write every day if you can.

I was waiting for a train at the Baltimore railway station on a very bad day. There were more people than I expected. The station didn't feel clean and calm like it usually does. There were elderly couples with suitcases, and college students with big backpacks. A well-dressed man was talking to strangers. He asked a woman if she was going to Philadelphia. Then he came to a girl with blonde hair who was standing near me. I thought I might talk to her. The man asked her if she was going to Philadelphia, but she said she was going to New York. He moved on to the next person.
Now he was talking to an old lady. I straightened up and walked a little closer. I was going to Philadelphia, but he didn't ask me. He looked at me and then went to talk to another couple. He looked very worried.
He asked a woman reading a book if she was going to Philadelphia. She said yes, and he asked her for a favor. I stopped walking and looked down. The woman looked a bit suspicious. The man said it wasn't a big favor, and he was trying to help his daughter. His daughter was going to fly to Philadelphia and had forgotten her passport. He had told her to stay at the station and he would get someone to bring her passport.
The woman asked him why he didn't go himself, but he said he couldn't leave his wife alone because she is in a wheelchair. I thought this was a strange excuse. I looked at the two of them. The man had a big envelope with something inside. It was padded and stapled shut. I thought, "Be careful, lady!"

My son Gary is a famous TV chef. I, John Moore, own a restaurant and have a good relationship with Gary. I believe everyone gets a chance in life. When I saw the restaurant, it was in a bad state, but I saw an opportunity. I thought about my childhood when my mother worked in a factory and I was left alone. I wanted to make sure our family had time together. My wife helped with the business and took care of the children. We lived above the restaurant and always had meals together. This helped our children, Gary and Joe, become confident. Gary was a lively child and started helping out in the kitchen when he was young. He worked hard and was very good at it. By the time he was 15, he was as good as the other chefs. He went to catering college and did very well. Now, he has his own TV cookery show. I'm very proud of him. I always told him that if you want something, you have to work hard for it. He took his chance and worked hard to become successful. I'm happy that he listened to what I said.

Here is a simplified version of the passage at the A2 level:
Finding a flat in Dublin was like finding a treasure. Jo had just moved to Dublin and didn't know anyone. She had to stay in a hostel and look for a flat. It was like trying to find a needle in a haystack. Jo felt like she was stepping into the unknown. She didn't ask herself why she was moving to Dublin. Everyone at school thought she would go to Dublin. It was a big city, and Jo had never been there before.
Jo's family thought she should stay in the hostel. Her mother thought it was a safe place, and her father worried it would be cold. Jo's sisters thought she was crazy for staying in a hostel for so long. But Jo wanted to find a flat.
Jo saw an ad for a flat in Ringsend. It said she could have her own room, TV, and share the kitchen and bathroom. It was near her work at the post office. She hoped it was true. There weren't many people waiting for this flat because it said "Third Girl Wanted". Jo wondered if it was too expensive, but the house looked normal. A girl named Nessa was coming down the stairs. She said the flat was not great, but Jo didn't care. Nessa and her friend Pauline were nice. They offered Jo a cup of tea and a mug with "Other" written on it.

People love dolphins. They are very intelligent and can understand human emotions. We often see them in films and TV shows. But, according to the Whale and Dolphin Conservation Society, dolphins are in trouble. Mark Simmonds reports on the decline of the species.
Dolphins are special animals that live in the sea. There are many kinds of dolphins, but some are in danger. The North Sea harbour porpoise population has decreased by up to 89,000. You might think that such popular animals would be protected, but they are not.
There are many dolphins in the waters of northern Europe. Some live far out in the sea, while others are found near European coasts. The bottlenose dolphin and the harbour porpoise used to be common near European coasts, but now they are rare. They are stressed and injured, and we don't know why.
Dolphins are in danger because of overfishing, which is reducing the world's fish stocks. This makes it hard for dolphins to find food. They also get caught in fishermen's nets, which can be invisible to them. In recent years, many dead dolphins have been found on beaches, with marks and cuts on their bodies showing that they were caught in nets.
Dolphins can also get sick from pollution in the sea. They can store waste and poisons in their bodies, which can harm them and their babies. For example, pesticides can build up in a dolphin's body and be passed on to its baby through its milk. In one case, a baby dolphin was poisoned and killed by its mother's milk.
The final threat to dolphins is noise pollution. Dolphins live in groups and communicate with each other through sound. But human noise, such as from ships and oil wells, can disturb them in ways we don't yet understand.

EXERCISE IS GOOD FOR YOU
Exercise is important for your body, mind, and spirit. It helps you feel good and stay healthy. There are many reasons why you should exercise. It makes your muscles stronger and helps you look better. It also helps you sleep better and feel less stressed.
Exercise can help you with problems like depression and tiredness. It can even help with some medical conditions. There are many types of exercise you can do, like aerobics, jogging, and weightlifting.
Remember to start slowly and carefully when you begin exercising. It's also a good idea to talk to a doctor before you start. Good posture is important too. If you slouch, try to imagine a helium balloon pulling your head up towards the sky. This will help you stand up straight and breathe more easily.
Stretching is important to improve your flexibility and prevent injuries. You should stretch four or five times a week. The best exercise routine includes a warm-up, stretching, a good workout, and a cool-down.

Amanda Barrett and Owen Newman are filmmakers who travel to Africa to make documentaries about animals. They stay in the same place for months to get the perfect shot. The rain in the Ngorongoro Crater has made it hard for them to get around. Owen says they had to buy a special vehicle to help them get unstuck when they get stuck in the mud.
Amanda and Owen work well together because they see the animals in the same way. They make their own meals and drink tea from a thermos. They often stay away from home for up to eight weeks to make a film. It's not easy, but they like being alone in the wild and getting close to the animals.
Amanda and Owen have been working together since 1988. They make a script and then go on location to film. They want to make films that are beautiful and make people feel something. They think it's better to make people feel something in their hearts than just their heads.

Meet England's Netball Captain
Suzie Ellis interviewed Kendra Slawinski, the captain of England's netball team. Kendra has a busy schedule before the World Championships. She teaches at a local school and then trains in a supermarket car park. I was surprised to hear about her training venue. 'I'm too focused on my movements and feet to notice anything else,' she said.
Kendra's life is all about getting ready for the World Championships. She has a strict schedule to get fit. This is her fourth time playing in the World Championships, and it will be the biggest one yet. 27 countries will be taking part.
We will have home support, which is special. It's important for netball in England to be well-known. There will be more pressure than usual because we will have a home crowd. They will expect us to play well.
Our first game is against Barbados. We usually win against them, but they will be tough to play. The England team is currently ranked fourth in the world. But Kendra says it will be tough. We have to play well every day, and there's no rest between games. We can still win if we lose the first game, but the Championships are different. We only get one chance, and we have to be ready.
Netball has become harder and faster over the years. Players are more aggressive on the court. But after the game, we are all friendly. Netball is also using new ways to test our fitness. As captain, I have to be strong and lead by example.
I plan to stop playing after this competition. But I will probably coach young players in the future. When I lead my team out at the opening ceremony, I will probably have a tear in my eye. My supporters will be behind me every step of the way.

Rachel Mills is a scientist who loves to spend time at the bottom of the Atlantic Ocean. She teaches and studies the chemicals in the sea. Rachel works at the Oceanography Centre at Southampton University. When she's not teaching, she goes down to the ocean floor in a special vehicle that's like a small car. It takes her three hours to get down, and she stays there for 10 hours collecting samples of rock and water. Then she goes back up to the surface.
The vehicle is very small, so Rachel has to stay inside until someone opens the door from the outside. If something goes wrong, she can press a special button and a small escape boat will come out and take her to the surface. Rachel has made six dives so far. Last year, she went with a Russian team to a place with lots of underwater volcanoes. These volcanoes are like chimneys that blow out black smoke.
When Rachel isn't at sea, she works in her office at the university. She teaches and does research on underwater volcanoes, which are also called "black smokers". She loves her job and feels lucky to be able to explore the deep ocean. Rachel has been studying underwater volcanoes for three years and it's an amazing feeling to see them in person.

**First Impressions Matter**
When we meet someone for the first time, we often form an opinion about them quickly. This is because we notice how they dress, how they talk, and how they move their body. Mary Pearce, a teacher, learned this the hard way. She had a small hole in her jacket when she went for a job interview, but she didn't change because she was worried about being late. Unfortunately, the interviewer thought she wasn't taking the job seriously.
Simon Grant, a hotel manager, agrees that how we look can affect how we come across. He says that if we don't take care of ourselves, we might not care about our work either. Many people forget to dress professionally for interviews, like Janet Goodwood, who didn't get an interview for a promotion because of her clothes.
Our body language and facial expressions also matter. A psychologist found that 55% of how we feel comes from our facial expressions, not what we say. We should make sure our words and body language match. It's also important not to show too much excitement or eagerness for a job. Sheila Rice, a marketing specialist, learned this the hard way when she got a job offer and reacted too enthusiastically.
Finally, knowing what to say and how to say it can make a difference. David Artesio, a job agency manager, suggests researching the company before an interview and asking questions about areas that interest you. Marian Woodall, a business consultant, advises using short, clear sentences and being prepared with questions.

'I Changed My Job
Matt Froggatt used to work in the city as an insurance agent. He was bored and unhappy. Then, he was fired. He got a small amount of money and used it to start a sheep farm. Now, he sells his sheep meat to a local hotel and through the mail.
Ron Ablewhite used to work in advertising. He was good at painting and decided to become an artist. He talked to a career advisor and they helped him make the change.
Katherine Goodison used to be a lawyer. She was tired of working long hours and wanted to start her own business. She makes hats and sells them to private clients. She loves her new job because she is in control and has deadlines.
Paul Drinkwater used to work in finance. He was not happy and wanted to change. He took a year off and traveled. He learned about health and fitness and became a masseur. He is happy now because he has control over his life.'

**Four Young Sports Stars Talk About Their Lives**
A Darius (runner) I like sports. When I was young, I played many sports, but I was best at football and running. When I was 14, I tried out for a professional football team, but I chose to focus on running instead. My best moment was when I got to run for my country and won a medal. Unfortunately, it didn't get much attention from the media. I have to train a lot, both at home and away. I go to Florida for three weeks before the season starts. It's fun, but I have to say no to going out with friends the night before training. Being dedicated is important in my sport. My goal is to go to the next Olympics.
B Gabriel (surfer) Surfing is a small community, so I see the same people everywhere I compete. Professional surfers are serious and usually go out early in the morning to find the best waves. I have to give up late nights and lie-ins, but it's worth it because it helped me win the National Championships. After a big win, I like to celebrate with my friends. I also got a TV show because of my win, so I'm a bit famous now.
C Dieter (yacht racer) It's fun racing with my friends on a boat. We like to celebrate our wins together. Sometimes reporters ask us about where we go out and what we do, but we don't try to get attention. I'm away for eight months a year, so it's nice to go back home and do normal things. I'm known in the sailing world, but not many people recognize me on the street. I like getting letters from fans and try to answer every one.
D Tomas (tennis player) It's great to play in front of a crowd. At my last tournament, it got a bit crazy, but I still like being recognized by fans when I'm out and about. However, it can be a problem. My last girlfriend didn't like it when I got attention from female fans. As a tennis player, I have to travel a lot, which is why we broke up. You have to make sacrifices in sports. I'm focusing on my game now and will catch up on other things when I retire.

Shopping with children can be very difficult for some mothers. They want everything they see, like new toys, sweets, and games. But mothers often can't afford all these things and feel guilty when they say no. They worry that if they say yes, they will be giving their children too much junk food. On the other hand, if they say no, they feel bad and get upset. Some mothers try to avoid taking their children shopping, but they worry that their children won't learn to make their own choices.
Research shows that children ask for something every two minutes when they are shopping with their parents. Many companies spend a lot of money advertising to children, especially on TV. This can make it hard for parents to explain to their children why they can't have something. Children often don't understand why their parents say no, and parents feel like they are competing with the advertising companies.
Some parents feel stressed when they have to decide what to buy and what not to buy. They want to teach their children to make good choices, but it's hard to say no all the time. One mother says she talks to her son about different products and looks at labels with him. This helps him understand that advertisements are not always true. Now, they don't argue as much when they are shopping.
Some parents admit that they are not always consistent in what they allow their children to buy. They might say no to their child's request for sweets, but then buy chocolate for themselves. It's hard to be fair and consistent all the time. Supermarkets could make it easier for parents by moving sweets to a different part of the store or providing a play area for children. This might make parents more likely to shop there.

The Merrion Hotel is a five-star hotel in Dublin. It was made from four old houses that were converted into a new hotel. This way, the hotel could have the latest technology. The hotel's manager, Peter MacCann, wants his staff to know the guests by name. The hotel's computer system helps them remember guests' preferences. For example, if a guest likes a certain type of music, the hotel will play it for them on their next visit.
The hotel also has a special system to control the room temperature. Guests can change the temperature themselves, but they can also ask the staff to adjust it for them. The hotel has many modern amenities, like TVs, phones, and computers in each room. The hotel has also thought about the future and has extra cables and equipment that can be easily updated.
The hotel has many other facilities, like a swimming pool, gym, and restaurants. The food is very good, and the hotel has a famous chef who has a Michelin star. The hotel is very comfortable and welcoming, and the staff is very helpful.

I asked six women who love their lives to tell me how they get their energy. Here's what they said:
A. Jeanette, a journalist and author, said: 'I get energy from doing something new and exciting. I'm learning flamenco dancing now and it's great! I also feel good when I'm doing something that helps me grow as a person.'
B. Linda, a magazine editor, said: 'I enjoy my work, so it doesn't feel like a chore. I need a good night's sleep to feel energized. Exercise helps too, but it's hard to find the energy to do it!'
C. Annie, a disc jockey, said: 'I get energy from being positive and enthusiastic. I love my job and the people I work with. I believe in enjoying life and setting goals for myself.'
D. Floella, an author and children's TV presenter, said: 'My energy comes from doing things I enjoy and believe in. I love working with kids and seeing how they can make me smile. It's like a natural chemical reaction!'
E. Deborah, an author and playwright, said: 'I love creating something from nothing, like making a garden out of a wasteland. I also get energy from knowing that people want to read what I write.'
F. Katherine, a therapist, said: 'I believe you need to be interested in what you do and respect yourself. I like to take risks and try new things to stay motivated. Don't waste your energy on things you don't enjoy!'

'ICE SKATING Ice skating has been around for a very long time. People used animal bones to make skates a long time ago. In Scandinavia, skating was important for the rich people. In the early 20th century, skating was fashionable, but a young girl named Sonja Henie changed the way people skated at the 1924 Winter Olympics. Now, skating combines art and sports. It's both beautiful and challenging.
To start, you need to be balanced and in control. You need to bend your knees and lean slightly forward. It's important to relax while skating. To start, stand with your heels almost touching and your feet pointing outwards. Move one foot forward and then the other. It's easy, right? As you get better, you can try longer movements.
It's important to know how to fall safely. Even good skaters fall sometimes. To fall safely, relax as much as possible. When you get up, use your hands to get into a kneeling position and then stand up.
Once you're comfortable moving on the ice, you can try different styles, like figure skating, free skating, and speed skating. The best way to start is to learn figure skating and then free skating. Many ice rinks offer lessons, so you can learn quickly.
Look at good skaters and you'll see how relaxed they are. To be like them, you should exercise regularly. You should warm up before skating and cool down afterwards. Skating is good for your balance, coordination, and overall health. It's also good for your heart and lungs. You can combine skating with swimming or jogging for a great workout.'

'Trills and tears of joy! Three young stars and their mothers talk about their lives. A. Annika Reeder is 15 and won a gold medal for gymnastics. She wants to be a physiotherapist and compete in the Olympics. 'I work very hard. I don't have time for TV or going out with friends. I only do gym and school. Sometimes I'm very tired, but my coach gives me a day off. Usually, I just keep going.'
B. Annika's mother says, 'Annika showed great potential from a young age. She loves gymnastics and it's given her confidence. She used to be shy, but now she's made friends from all over the world.'
C. Sarah Stokes is 15 and loves show-jumping. She's won the British National Championship. 'My parents like show-jumping, so they help me train and take me to shows. I don't get tired of it - I love it! I'm determined to win a gold medal at the Olympics.'
D. Sarah's mother says, 'Sarah loves horses. She's been riding since she was 1 year old. To compete in big shows, we have to travel all over England. We even sleep in our horse box to save money.'

Chris Greener is the tallest man in Britain. He is 228 cm tall. This is because people in Europe are getting taller. Every year, more people are born who are very tall. But this doesn't mean we are becoming a new super race. It's like we are going back to how we were a long time ago.
Many years ago, people didn't eat the same food as we do now. They ate different foods like fruits, berries, and animals. This made them strong and healthy. But then, people started farming and eating the same foods every day. This made them weak and unhealthy.
Now, some countries are eating better and getting taller again. The average height in the US, Holland, and Japan is getting higher. But, there are some problems. Beds and seats on planes and trains are still the same size, and clothes are getting harder to make. We don't know how tall we can get, but some scientists think we might reach 193 cm this century.
However, some scientists think that as a species, we are actually getting smaller. A long time ago, people were bigger and round because it helped them stay warm. Now, as the climate gets warmer, we might get smaller again. This means that even if we are eating well, we might not get taller forever.

Have you ever wondered what it's like to be in the audience when a TV show is being recorded? I went to a TV studio to find out. Many people think that studio audiences are weird, but they're not. They come from all walks of life. TV producers try to get different types of people for different shows.
Some people might think, "Why would anyone want to sit in a studio for hours to watch TV when they can watch it at home?" But there are reasons why people want to be in the studio. Some people want to be on TV for a few seconds. Others are curious to see how TV shows are made. And some just got a ticket from a friend.
When you're in a studio audience, you sit with strangers and follow signs that tell you when to clap or laugh. But it's not always like that. Sometimes the show is good enough that you don't need signs. I went to a studio and it was exciting, but I missed seeing the actors up close. Watching TV at home is different from being in a studio, but for many people, it's just a fun night out.

I like places with people and things that humans have built. When I travel, I like to visit old villages with temples, not empty deserts. When I was a child, I went to school in England and loved exploring the countryside. I would cycle to a village called Lastingham and visit the hills and valleys. I still go back there today.
I like a special train ride in England. The train goes from Hythe to Dungeness and passes through people's backyards. I like seeing people doing everyday things like making tea or doing laundry. It's nice to see what other people are doing.
I also like a place called the Hartland Peninsula. It's a beautiful and quiet coast with few people. The beaches are rocky and hard to reach, but the sea is very big and powerful. You can walk along the coast and then go inland to see old oak trees and wildflowers.
My friend Annette likes a place called the Trough of Bowland. It's a big, open area with no many people. She likes to hike there and feel the space.
My friend James bought a house in a place called Glenthorne. It's a special house that he loves. He grew up in a different country, but he went to school in England and loved cycling around the countryside. He found Glenthorne by chance and it's his favorite place in Britain.

We love animals. One day, my daughter found a snake. She asked if we could keep it. I said yes, but only for one night. We have a special tank for animals that pass through our house. I was late getting home, so I hurried to put dinner on the stove. When I got to my sons' room, I heard screams. My cat, Domino, had caught a mouse. The mouse was waving its feet in the air. Domino was running around the room, trying to get away from the kids. I tried to help, but I tripped and fell. When I looked up, I saw the snake was loose. It was sliding out of its tank and all over the floor. I was scared, so I crouched down like a rabbit. The snake was hissing and striking at everything. The cat, mouse, and kids were all running around, screaming. I finally managed to catch the cat and get the mouse out of its mouth. The snake was too strong, so I had to be careful. I sat down on the floor and slowly moved my hands under the snake's body. When I stood up, I pointed to a tree and let the snake go. It slid up my shoulder and wrapped itself around me like a blanket. We stood there in the dark, my kids, me, and the snake. My oldest son said, "You're warm and comfortable, and the shed isn't." I told the kids to gently push the snake towards the wall. It slowly moved up the wall and disappeared over the roof. My three-year-old son said, "Wow, that was a big snake!"

"Write to me! In today's world of phones and computers, writing letters is becoming less popular. But I think it's special to receive a letter. There's the excitement of getting it, seeing who it's from, and reading the message. I've been writing letters for as long as I can remember. When I was little, I would write notes to my mom. My mom always wanted me to write thank-you letters for presents. It didn't matter if they were short or messy, as long as they were letters.
When I moved to London to study to be a doctor, I would write to my mom once a week. Sometimes my dad would write too, and it was always fun to read his letters. The letters from home usually told us about what was happening with my parents and their friends. We would also talk on the phone, but I remember the letters more.
I also wrote letters to my boyfriends when I was younger. I seemed to attract people who had to work or study away from home, and letters were the only way we could stay in touch. Writing letters actually helped our relationships. I found it easier to express myself in writing than talking.
I love getting letters with birthday or Christmas cards. Notes are nice, but it's even better to get a year's worth of news! And it's extra special if the letter comes from far away, with fun stamps.
I have penfriends in different countries, like Sri Lanka and Australia. I also have a penfriend in France, whom I met in a restaurant. If I hadn't asked for her address, we might not be writing to each other now. It's important to keep writing letters. I'm happy to see my children writing letters too. Like my mom, I want them to write their own thank-you letters. My daughter writes me little notes, just like I did to my mom. She and my son have penfriends in Texas, arranged by my penfriend. I think it's important to keep writing letters, and not let it become a lost art."

Many ancient pictures on a mountain in France are being damaged. These pictures are very old, over 4,000 years old. They were drawn on the rocks by people who lived a long time ago. The pictures show things like cows, fields, and gods and goddesses.
But now, many tourists are visiting the mountain and damaging the pictures. They are not careful and are touching the drawings, which is wearing them away. Some people even take pieces of the rock as souvenirs. Others try to make the pictures clearer by rubbing them, but this is also damaging them.
Scientists and researchers are worried that if the damage continues, the pictures will be gone in 50 years. They want to find a way to protect the site. Some people think that the best way is to make the whole mountain a "no-go" area, so only guided tours can visit. Others think that this would be too strict and that people should be able to visit the site, but with guides.
The problem is that there is no money to hire enough guards to protect the site. Some people think that charging a fee to visit the site could help pay for the guards. Others think that the government should provide the money to protect the site because it is a historic site.
The scientists are worried that if they don't do something, the pictures will be lost forever. They want to find a way to save them for future generations.

Research shows that children ask for something every two minutes when they're shopping. Companies spend a lot of money advertising to children, especially on TV. "Climbing is no longer just for the mountains. Now, you can climb anywhere, indoors or outdoors. At the World Cup Climbing Championships in Birmingham, a French climber named Francois Lombard is hanging upside down from his fingers. This is a big competition, and the crowd is watching closely.
Not long ago, climbers only had mountains to climb. But in the winter, the weather was too cold, so they had to stop climbing. They used to climb on snow and ice in Scotland instead. As the sport grew, climbers needed to stay fit. They started using walls to train, even on flat buildings. This helped them keep their fingers strong and not get bored.
Many sports centers built walls just for climbing. These walls were made with special edges to hold onto. One teacher, Don Robinson, built a climbing wall in his school in the 1960s. He had an idea to put real rock in concrete, which could be used in a wall. Many walls like this were built in sports halls across the country.
However, these walls had some problems. They could only be built straight up and down, not like the cliffs outside with overhangs and steep parts. And once the walls were built, they couldn't be changed, so climbers got bored. In 1985, a Frenchman named Francois Savigny invented a special material that could be molded into shapes like the ones on cliffs. This could be attached to any wall and then taken off when climbers wanted to try something new. French companies also started using panels on steel frames. This way, they could build walls that were free-standing and had many different holds to climb."

Do you want to be an actor? If you tell someone, they might say it's a risky job. And they're right! There are many people who want to be actors, but not many jobs available. Some friends might even tell you you're crazy for choosing this career. But it's a personal choice, and you have to take responsibility for yourself and your dreams.
Becoming an actor isn't easy. There's no special test or guarantee of success. It's a mix of luck and talent. But there's always a chance to find new faces and new talent. Acting can be exciting, glamorous, and sometimes very rewarding.
So, what makes someone a good actor? It's a natural skill combined with imagination. And imagination is hard to measure. It's also about being brave and believing in yourself.
Why do people want to act? It's often hard to explain. For actors, the most important thing is the moment when they connect with the audience. This connection is what drives them to act. When asked how they succeed, actors usually shrug and say they don't know. They know some things about themselves and their skills, but they never take anything for granted. They know their success can end at any moment.
Actors don't like to talk about their chances of getting a job. They find ways to protect themselves from stress and rejection. Nobody likes being rejected. From the start, actors know there's a chance they might not get the part they want. They have to be willing to take risks and show they care about their work.

Chris Greener is the tallest man in Britain. He is 228 cm tall. When he was 14, he wanted to join the navy. His teacher asked him what he wanted to be, and Chris said he wanted to be the flagpole on a ship. Chris is very tall because, on average, people in Europe are getting taller. Every year, more people are born who are very tall.
A long time ago, people didn't eat the same foods we eat today. They ate many different foods from nature. This made them strong and healthy. Then, people started farming. This changed what we eat. Now, most people eat just three foods: wheat, rice, and maize. This has made us unhealthy and not as strong as we used to be.
In the past, when people ate many different foods, they were healthy and strong. But when they started farming, they became unhealthy. Now, some countries are going back to eating more like our ancestors did. This is making people taller again. In the US, Japan, and Holland, people are getting taller.
But, there are some problems. Beds are still the same size they were 150 years ago. And, clothes don't fit as well as they used to. Scientists don't know how tall people will get. Some think we might get as tall as 193 cm. But, others think we might even get smaller. This is because the Earth is getting warmer, and people might get smaller to stay warm.

Two brothers, Dave and Norm Lagasse, love playing a game from their childhood. They are in their 40s and live in Santa Fe, New Mexico. The game is called pichenotte. Their grandfather, Lucien Rajotte, brought the game from Canada. The family played it every weekend and holiday. They moved to New Mexico, but they still played pichenotte. When visitors came, they were surprised because the game was not well-known in the USA.
One day, Dave made a new pichenotte board. People liked it, and soon they were making more. They took one to a sports bar in Santa Fe and people wanted to play. The brothers discovered that the game came from India and was played in Canada and Britain before coming to the USA.
Pichenotte is a game of skill. Players use small pieces (pucks) to flick across a board. The goal is to get the pucks into holes or rings. The game is easy to learn and takes only two minutes to play. The brothers started selling the boards at markets and craft fairs. People loved the game, and soon they were making more boards. They even created a championship and a trophy.
The brothers now make the boards full-time. They work in their garage and have made over 450 boards so far. Each board is made of birchwood and mahogany and weighs 12kg. They sell the boards on their website for $595 each. The brothers are happy to play the game they love and hope it will make them rich one day.

**Welcome to the Model Village**

One man, with the help of his wife, worked hard to turn this land into the beautiful village you see today. They moved a lot of soil and clay to create the hills and valleys. It was a big job that needed a lot of hard work.
They planted hundreds of trees and shrubs, but they had to choose the right ones for this place near the sea. The plants had to be able to handle the salty air and strong winds. Some plants came from local gardens, while others came from as far away as Canada and New Zealand.
The man who created the village, Colin Sims, made over 100 models by himself over nine years. He used different materials like stone, concrete, and plastic to make them strong. He learned how to make them by asking experts for help, but soon became an expert himself.
You will notice that all the models are the same size and have lots of details. This took a lot of patience and special techniques. The village is very popular and is known for its high quality and good maintenance. The techniques used here have been used in other model villages and even in schools.
The buildings in the village are based on traditional British styles and are not copies of real places. You will see a big stone house, a castle, a church, a zoo, and a mini golf course. Please stay on the paths and don't touch the models. You can take pictures from the paths, but not from close up. Dogs are welcome on a short leash.
We would like you to tell us what you think of the village and which models you like the most. We are always making new models and need your feedback to make the village even better. We hope you have a great time and will come back soon.

"Every week, British newspapers publish pictures that invade people's privacy and break the rules of journalism. Sometimes, famous people agree to have their pictures taken by the paparazzi. But usually, these pictures are taken without permission and cause harm to people who are in the public eye. These pictures are not in the public interest. They do not help us know about important news or keep us safe. 
Some famous people have been in the news recently because of private pictures being taken. One actress was photographed on her hotel balcony. She should have been left alone because it's a private place. But she didn't complain. The Press Complaints Commission (PCC) is supposed to help with problems like this. But they didn't take action. 
It's not fair that the PCC doesn't do more to stop these kinds of pictures. They should take the initiative and stop newspapers from publishing them. But it's not easy. The PCC would have to decide when to investigate and how to do it. They would also have to deal with famous people who might not want to complain. Some people might be worried that if they complain, the newspaper will find something else to write about them.

People are afraid to challenge the newspapers because they think they will be targeted again. It's hard to find a solution to this problem."

What is money? Money is like a measure, like a gram or a kilometre. The difference is that you can trade it for something else. A five-pound note can buy a book, a big bag of sweets, or two cinema tickets. But the note itself is just a piece of paper that doesn't cost much to make.
A long time ago, people didn't have money like we do now. There were no banks or shops. Instead, people traded things they had for things they needed. For example, Mr. Green, a farmer, would trade the corn he grew for honey from Mr. Hive. This was a deal between two people who had something the other wanted.
Later, most groups of people created their own money, so it was easier to trade. Different types of money started to work together, and that's why we use national money today.

'Grass is very good at growing. There are many kinds of grass - over 9,000! You can find them everywhere on Earth. Grass can even grow in very cold places like the Arctic and Antarctica. Every year, many people climb Ben Nevis, a big mountain in Scotland. It's very cold there because it's in the north. Keith Hewitt, a climber, went to Ben Nevis for the first time in February. He went up the north face of the mountain to Tower Ridge. It's a long way up - 600 metres. They planned to stay in a special place called the 'Carries' for three days. The Carries are like big bowls cut into the mountain. They brought tents, sleeping bags, and special spikes for their boots because the snow is very hard and slippery.
Even though some of the group were very experienced, they took many safety things with them, like lights, hats, and extra clothes. The weather was good, but everyone felt a bit nervous. Ben Nevis is a big challenge in winter. The track went up and my legs felt tired. I had to rest often because I was the weakest in the group. The others waited for me to catch up, but then they went on again. I promised myself to train better before the next climb.
After 200 metres, we reached the beginning of Tower Ridge. It's very narrow and the mountain drops down very far on both sides. We had to be careful and concentrate on every step. After seven hours, we reached the top. On a clear day, you can see the sea and even the island of Skye, which is 48 kilometres away. But it was misty when we were there. Going down the mountain can be just as hard as going up. You need to know how to read a map correctly or you might get lost. I was glad we took turns doing that job. It wasn't until I was safe in my tent that I really enjoyed the experience.

But it's also very special because it's designed to be good for the environment. The builders took a long time to build it, so we got to see it being made. It was fun to watch, but sometimes the noise was very loud. The builders had to stop work when it rained a lot.
Now we have five big classrooms. We share one room with the town people when they need to meet. There's also a nursery, a dining room, and big changing rooms. We're looking forward to using them when our new sports field is ready.
When you come into the school, you'll notice that it's warm inside, even without heaters. This is because we, the children, the teachers, and the computers all make heat. The building is designed to keep the heat inside. You can even hear us singing in the classrooms and it sounds like a concert hall!
You'll also see a tree on the roof. The builders put it there because it's a custom in Austria, where the roof was made. The electricity for our lights and computers comes from a big wind turbine on a hill behind the school. We went to see it yesterday and it's very big and fast. We took pictures and will put them on our website.
We're still using the school, but there are some things that need to be added, like a new hall for our play. It will be ready next year. We're very happy with our new school and our teachers think we'll learn even better now that we're here.

A month ago, I didn't know I would be climbing 30 meters high and having fun. Now, I'm looking down at the river and I understand why people like rock-climbing. My friend Matt and I went to the Activity Centre on Friday evening. The place wasn't perfect, but we had everything we needed. We were happy to be out of the city and in the fresh air. On Saturday morning, we met the other people in our group. Some friends, Cameron, Kevin, and Simon, came with their friends. Sisters Carole and Lynn came with their friend Amanda. We all came from different places and didn't know the area. We knew we would be outside all weekend, but we didn't know what we would do. Some of us went caving in the morning, and the others went rock-climbing. Matt and I went caving first. Getting out was harder than going in, but we did it!
