'Lost My Handbag on the Bus
I left my handbag on the bus on Saturday afternoon. It had my important things like my money, address book, and credit cards. When I realised what I had done, I was very worried. I didn't know what to do. I'm 72 years old and I was far from home. I stood by the road and cried.
A kind young man asked me what was wrong and I told him what happened. He gave me some money to help me get home. The bus driver said I didn't need to pay my fare. When I got home, the phone rang. It was the boss of CityBus, the company that owns the bus. He said they found my handbag and offered to bring it back to me. Amazingly, everything was still in it!
I want to say thank you to everyone who helped me that day. They were very kind and honest. - Mrs. B. James, Newport'

'Sharks are very scary creatures that live in the ocean. They can see and feel things underwater. This makes it easy for them to catch their food. Sharks are not like other fish. They need to swim all the time to breathe and stay alive. They don't sleep much. If you turn a shark over on its back, it will stop moving. This helps scientists who study sharks. It helps them learn more about these interesting animals.'

My name is Nathalie and I'm a ballet student at the Kirov Ballet in St Petersburg, Russia. I was very young when I started, and it was my first time in Russia. I was a bit nervous because I didn't know anyone. But everyone was nice and helped me. They spoke English, so we could communicate easily. Now, six months later, I'm feeling more comfortable. My Russian is improving, and I understand my teachers better.
My mum came with me to Russia for two weeks, and I was a bit sad when she left. I even called her late at night because I felt a little lonely. The ballet classes here are very hard, but I eat a lot to have energy. This makes me feel confident that I can do well.
In the evenings, I watch my favourite movies on my computer. Sometimes I fall asleep before the movie is finished. I like walking around the city and shopping. It was very cold in December, but I bought a warm hat. The Russians said it wasn't that cold, but it was warm in my room.
We are preparing for a new ballet show and there's a competition for young dancers that I'm going to enter. I feel very lucky to be here.

THE ICEHOTEL
For a long time, people went to the Arctic in the summer to see the midnight sun. But in the winter, the few people who lived there had the snow and ice all to themselves. One day, some people thought, "Why not use the cold and dark winter to build something special?" In 1990, a French artist named Jannot Derit was invited to build an igloo in a small town called Jukkasjarvi. The igloo was called Arctic Hall and many people came to visit.
One night, some brave visitors had the idea to sleep in the igloo. They were very happy with their experience and that's how the idea of an ice hotel was born. Now, every year, people from all over the world come to build the hotel. They make it bit by bit, and each part opens to visitors as it's finished. The hotel is built outside, using natural materials like snow and ice. When it's finished, it's ready for guests to stay in.
The hotel is very cold, but not too cold. It's always between -5°C and -8°C inside. You need to wear warm clothes, like a hat and gloves, and bring extra socks and a scarf. You can buy these things on the hotel's website when you book your stay. The hotel is in a small village called Jukkasjarvi, near the Arctic Circle. You can take a bus from the airport or train station to get there.

A new shop called Homestyle sells furniture. It opened at midnight on Thursday, but it had to close soon after because too many people came. There were special deals, like a sofa for PS45 and a bed for PS30, but only for a short time. The shop usually opens from 9 am to 9 pm, but it stayed open all night on its first day. However, it had to close after just half an hour because there were too many people. A police officer came to help, but the people outside got angry because they thought everything would sell out before they could get in. They didn't want to wait in line quietly. Another problem was that there were many cars trying to park, and some people left their cars in the middle of the road and walked the rest of the way to the shop. This blocked the road.
One customer, Jenny, was lucky enough to get into the shop. She waited for three hours, but didn't have time to buy what she wanted. The staff were calm and explained the situation. They had to close the shop because it wasn't safe. Jenny said she will come back when the shop reopens, but she doesn't want to wait in line again.

The Short Story Society is a group that helps writers in the UK. It was started in 1899 and is now one of the most active writing organizations in the country.
We publish two magazines: the Short Story Review and Short Story News. The Short Story Review has stories from famous British writers and also gives new writers a chance to have their work published. Short Story News has interviews with writers and information about writing events and competitions.
We also run a big writing competition called the National Short Story Competition. Anyone over 18 can enter, and the stories can be about anything. The stories should be between 1,000 and 1,500 words long. There is no fee for members, but non-members have to pay £5. The competition runs from April to October. The best stories will be published in a book, and the winner will get a contract to publish their own book.
The Society also goes into schools to help children and teachers with writing. We have a project for young writers aged 11-18, and the winners get book prizes and a writing course.
We have a cafe where members can meet and relax. It's in the heart of London and is open from 11 am to 10 pm on weekdays and 11 am to 8 pm on Saturdays. Members get discounts on some things.
Anyone over 18 can join the Society. If you want to join, you can click here and fill out a form.

Tanya Streeter is a world champion free-diver. She holds four records in this sport. Free-diving is when people dive deep into the ocean without breathing equipment. In 2003, Tanya made history by diving 120 meters deep into the ocean and coming back up without help. She was the first person to do this. Before, she had gone deeper, but she used a balloon to come back up. This time, she held her breath for over three minutes. This made her the only woman to break a world record set by a man.
Some people think free-diving is too dangerous, but Tanya says safety is the most important thing. She also thinks training is very important. Tanya trains hard every day. Two-thirds of her training is on land, and the rest is in the pool or in the ocean. She also uses a special bike to make her heart strong.
Tanya usually travels to different places to train. She does 14 dives over four weeks, with a rest day in between. She needs to stay fit and healthy so she can do her best. When she's not training, Tanya does public appearances to promote sports products. She also helps protect the environment by doing research and making films.
Tanya grew up on a Caribbean island where she loved swimming and exploring the ocean. She says her life is like living her childhood dreams. Because she's famous, people listen to her when she talks about protecting the environment. Tanya plans to keep breaking her own records and will continue free-diving for many years to come.

"ANIMATED FILMS Animated films are very flexible. If you can draw, you can make it move on the big screen. New ideas and special computer programs make cartoons exciting again. In the past, people thought cartoons were only for kids. But then some directors came up with new ideas. They showed that cartoons could be fun for both kids and grown-ups. Not every cartoon film was a success. One film, The Black Cauldron, didn't do well because it was too scary for kids and too childish for grown-ups. The directors learned from this mistake, and soon film companies started making a lot of money again."

I never expected to be in a TV show called The Finnegans. I was only acting at school, but I loved the book since I was 11. My grandmother said I was like Polly Finnegan, and I always wanted to play her. I took a year off to travel before going to university. While I was in Chile, my mom told me they were making a TV show based on the book. I knew I had to try out for the part. My mom sent my picture to the director and convinced him to meet me. I went back and got the part. We filmed outdoors for three weeks, and then I went back to university. I got up early to catch up on my schoolwork. My friends found out, and they thought it was cool. It was an amazing experience. I'm very lucky. After university, I want to be an actress. My grandfather was an opera singer, but I'm not from an acting family. I've tried for other TV parts, but haven't gotten any yet. I don't know how I did it all, because I had a social life too. When filming finished, I didn't know what to do. I've been in two college plays. Now my first year at university is over, I'm going to Greece with my friends for the summer.

'I started the first 'Body Shop' in 1976 to earn money for my family. Today, 'The Body Shop' is a big company with stores all around the world. Over the years, I have learned many things. Some of what I have learned is in this book. I think we have something important to say about how to run a successful business and still do what we believe in.
This book is not like other business books. It's not just about my life. The message is that to be successful in business, you have to be different. Business can be fun, and it can make people happy. I want the people who work for 'The Body Shop' to feel happy and excited to come to work. I hope this book will share these ideas with the world and make them public. I think it's exciting to think that our 'family' can grow and do many great things. I hope you think so too.'

'TAKE A JOURNEY ALONG THE DOURO RIVER
The MV Lady Ivy May is a special boat that takes 160 guests on a trip along the Douro River in Portugal. The boat has air-conditioning and many nice places to relax, like a sun-deck, lounge, bar, dining room, shop, and library.
Day 1: We fly from London to Oporto and meet our guide. We stay on the boat overnight.
Day 2: We visit Oporto in the morning and then go back to the boat. We sail to Entre-os-Rios, which takes four hours.
Day 3: We continue sailing up the river. In the evening, we stop at Peso da Regua, where we can try some delicious food and drink.
Day 4: We visit the old town of Lamego and see a cathedral, churches, and a museum. The museum used to be a palace and has many nice paintings, tapestries, and sculptures.
Day 5: We sail to Tua, where the river gets very narrow. If the water is deep enough, we can take a smaller boat to the Spanish border. Otherwise, we take a bus.
Day 6: We go to Sao Joao da Pesqueira for a beautiful view. We have lunch on the boat and then take a train ride through the countryside to Regua, where our boat is waiting.
Day 7: We visit Vila Real and then go back to the boat for lunch. We sail to Oporto in the afternoon.
Day 8: We arrive in Oporto in the morning and have some free time to explore before flying back to London.'

"Honey is a sweet liquid made by bees. It's made from water and sugar. Bees work hard to make honey. They fly far and visit many flowers to make just a little bit of honey. The color and taste of honey depend on the flowers they visit. There are many types of honey. Some are lighter and taste milder, while others are darker and taste stronger. A long time ago, honey was a special food because sugar was rare. People used to trade honey as money. Today, honey is made and eaten all around the world. Some scientists think that honey can help us feel less tired and perform better in sports. Honey is not just for eating. It can also help with sore throats and is used in many beauty products for skin and hair."

Norwich is a city in East Anglia, a part of Britain. It has been a place to live for over 2,000 years. A long time ago, it was a small village near a river. By the time the Normans came to England in 1066, Norwich had grown into a big town. There are two big churches and a mosque in Norwich. One of the churches was built in 1095 and recently celebrated its 900th birthday. Norwich got a special permission to be called a city and make its own decisions in 1194.
Norwich is a small city compared to cities like London or Manchester, with a population of about 150,000 people. But a long time ago, it was the second biggest city in England. Over the years, it grew and became richer. Norwich was famous for having many churches and pubs. Nowadays, there are fewer churches and pubs, but Norwich has a university and is a good place for business. The city has many things to do, like going to the cinema, eating at nice restaurants, and visiting museums.
Norwich has a football team called the Canaries, but nobody knows why they chose that name. The city has a new shopping centre called the Castle Mall, and people can walk through a park in the middle of the city. The old market is still there, and it's popular with locals and visitors. Norwich has managed to keep its old and new parts of the city together, which is nice.

The Albuquerque Balloon Festival Every year, the city of Albuquerque in the United States has a big balloon festival. It's a nine-day event. The first festival was in 1972. It started with just a few balloons, but now it's much bigger. This year, balloons from many countries will come to the festival.
What to see and do At night, the pilots make their balloons light up together. This is called a 'balloon glow'. It's a great time to take pictures. But you have to come early or late to see it. During the day, you can walk around the balloons and talk to the pilots. The balloons come in different sizes and shapes, like animals or cartoon characters. Kids will love it!
You can also go on a balloon ride over the desert or take a cable car to the top of the nearby mountains. There are many other things to do, like balloon races and fireworks.
The Albuquerque Box This is a special wind pattern that helps the balloons fly. The mountains protect the balloons from strong winds and make it easier for pilots to control their direction.
Practical tips Buy your tickets online to avoid waiting in line. Wear thin clothes, as it can be cold at night and early morning. Bring sunglasses, suncream, a flashlight, and your camera. If you're not digital, bring high-speed film for night-time pictures.

The Eden Project is a very popular place to visit in the south-west of England. It's a big project that was built on an old industrial site. At first, it looks like a scene from a science fiction movie because of the big domes. Each dome is like a different world, showing how important plants are for people. Did you know that many things we use every day come from plants, like wood, rubber, fruit, and chocolate? There are over 135,000 different types of plants here. It's always warm inside the domes, no matter what the weather is like outside. In one part, it's always damp and misty, like a rainforest. Another part is like the Mediterranean, California, and South Africa. They are planning to add a desert zone soon.

"Best Age to Learn Violin: Three to Six"
Margaret Porter, a violin teacher, says that the best age to start learning the violin is between three and six years old. This is because children learn about the world at this age. Margaret teaches children at her home in London. She usually teaches children who are three or four years old, but sometimes she makes exceptions for very keen five-year-olds.
Margaret's students have group lessons. There are about 12 children in each group, and they meet once every two weeks. Each child also has a one-on-one lesson with Margaret once a week. Parents must come to the lessons too. It's important for parents to help their children learn.
At first, children learn to play the violin by listening. They don't learn to read music until they've been playing for a few years. There's a big difference between playing and reading music. Margaret's method is not meant to make children into great violinists. If a child is very good, she suggests they go to a different teacher who uses a more traditional way of teaching.

'Moonshine is a band. They just released their third CD. It's called "Here Again". This is the next one after "The Waves". There are some new members in the band. Tom Wilcott is now playing the bass guitar, and Tom Simpson is the new drummer. They used to have a different drummer, Simon McVee, but he left the band last year.
The first two songs on the CD are very upbeat and fun to dance to. They are different from the slow songs the band usually makes. The rest of the CD is more like their usual style. These two new songs might surprise some fans, but they are very good and could be big hits.
The singer, Rob Letchford, does a great job singing these songs. He can sing really well and reaches the high notes perfectly. Unfortunately, he had some trouble with his throat, so the band had to cancel their next tour. But don't worry, they will reschedule the concerts when Rob feels better.
Moonshine can make many kinds of music, from slow songs to fast and fun ones. This CD has a little bit of everything. I think they saved their best songs for the beginning and the end, and the middle ones are not as good. But overall, "Here Again" is a great CD and will probably be very popular.'

'San Francisco is a city on the west coast of the United States. A long time ago, a Spanish explorer named Gaspar de Portola was the first European to see the area. He arrived in 1769. San Francisco Bay is a beautiful and safe place for boats to dock. In 1849, many people came to San Francisco to look for gold. But it wasn't the people who found gold who became rich. The richest people made their money by working in banks and law offices. They built big houses on a hill called Nob Hill. Today, people visit San Francisco to see famous places like Chinatown and the Golden Gate Bridge. Some people also take a short boat trip to Alcatraz Island to see the old prison.'

'SAMUEL PEPYS Samuel Pepys wrote a famous diary. It tells us about everyday life in England from 1660 to 1669. He writes about big news, like sickness, a foreign navy coming up the River Thames, and a big fire in London. He also writes about himself, like when he falls asleep in church or looks at pretty girls. He talks about his home life, like when he and his wife argue and then make up, and when she gets sick. He likes books, music, plays, card games, and parties with good food. Pepys was a busy person who did many important jobs, like being in Parliament and helping the Royal Society. He also helped the British Navy.'

'A Long Time Ago, Shoes Were Not Important
A long time ago, people didn't care about shoes being comfortable or looking good. They wore animal skins on their feet to keep warm. We still use leather today, but we also use other materials like silk, plastic, or cotton. It wasn't until 150 years ago that people started wearing different shoes on each foot. Before that, people wore the same shoe on both feet. All shoes were made by hand, but now most are made in big factories using machines. The invention of sewing machines helped make shoes cheaper and more available for everyone.'

"I hurt my back and had to stop running. I wanted to share my love for running with other women and show them how much fun it can be. I started a running group for women in my area because I was upset about how some race organizers treat women. They complain that there aren't enough women running, but they don't provide separate changing rooms for them. I put up posters and 40 women joined. They were all interested in losing weight, but they didn't know much about running. They thought it would be hard and painful. But now they enjoy running and chatting with each other in nice places like by a river. They started with just one minute of running and now they can run for 30 minutes. They've also learned about healthy eating and exercise from other runners. I'm happy to see how much they've improved - almost as happy as they are!"

A LONG TIME AGO, PEOPLE CAME TO ALASKA TO FIND GOLD. THEY BUILT NEW TOWNS, INCLUDING ONE CALLED IDITAROD. IN THE WINTER, IT WAS HARD TO GET TO THESE TOWNS BECAUSE THE RIVERS AND OCEAN FROZE. SO, PEOPLE BUILT A SPECIAL TRACK FOR DOGS TO PULL SLEDS. THESE DOGS TOOK MAIL, FOOD, AND CLOTHES TO THE GOLD MINERS. THE TRACK WAS CALLED THE IDITAROD TRAIL. IT TOOK THE DOGS ABOUT THREE WEEKS TO GET FROM ONE END TO THE OTHER.
IN THE 1920S, PLANES BECAME MORE POPULAR, AND PEOPLE DIDN'T NEED TO USE DOGS AS MUCH. BUT IN 1925, A BAD DISEASE CALLED DIPHTHERIA CAME TO THE CITY OF NOME. THE ONLY WAY TO CURE IT WAS WITH A SPECIAL MEDICINE, BUT IT WAS ON THE OTHER SIDE OF ALASKA. THE PLANES WERE TOO NEW AND NOT GOOD ENOUGH TO FLY IN THE COLD WEATHER. SO, THEY DECIDED TO USE DOGS AGAIN TO BRING THE MEDICINE. IT TOOK 20 TEAMS OF DOGS JUST SIX DAYS TO COMPLETE THE JOURNEY. ONE DOG, BALTO, WAS VERY BRAVE AND HELPED SAVE THE TEAM. NOW, EVERY YEAR, PEOPLE HOLD A DOG SLED RACE FROM ANCHORAGE TO NOME, FOLLOWING THE SAME ROUTE AS THE FAMOUS JOURNEY IN 1925. IT'S CALLED THE IDITAROD AND IS KNOWN AS 'THE LAST GREAT RACE ON EARTH'.

The Ice Hotel in Sweden is very special. It's in a place called Jukkasjarvi, where it can get very cold - as cold as -40°C in winter! But 6,000 people visit every year. This hotel is different because it's made of ice! You can eat, drink, and sleep in rooms made of ice. You can even get married there! The bar is also made of ice, so don't put hot drinks on it! The bedrooms are a bit cold, around -4°C, but you'll be given special sleeping bags to keep you warm. If you need, you can also borrow special clothes to wear outside. The hotel is rebuilt every year because it melts in the summer. It takes a lot of work to build it - 10,000 tonnes of ice and 30,000 tonnes of snow!

Maria Mutola was a girl who loved playing football with boys in Mozambique. She was very good and her team won a game. But some people didn't think it was fair that a girl was playing with boys. A man named Jose Craveirinha saw Maria playing and thought she was fast. He asked her to run and she didn't know what he meant. He taught her about athletics and bought her special shoes. Maria worked hard and her legs hurt, but Jose believed in her. He talked to her parents and they let him take her to train in the United States. Maria was scared to leave her family, but she went and met new friends who were also athletes. They were different from her because they worried about clothes and makeup, not about having enough food. Maria was happy to be there and learned a lot. Now, Maria still runs and lives in South Africa with her mother.

The Grand Canyon in the United States was made by the River Colorado. Many people visit the Grand Canyon Park to walk, run, and look at the view. The view is very nice, and it's even better with the Skywalk. The Skywalk is a special platform that lets you see the beautiful rocks of the canyon. It's 1219 meters from the Skywalk to the bottom of the canyon. You can only stand on it with 120 people at the same time. It opened in 2007 and many people have used it since then. You need to wear special shoes covers so you don't scratch the glass. When you walk on the Skywalk, it feels like you're flying high in the air like a bird.

THE ROCKIES
The Rocky Mountains are a big mountain range in North America. They go from north to south. They are not as big as the Alps, but they are still very beautiful. There are many roads in the Rockies, but the best way to see them is to take the train. You start in Vancouver, a big and nice city in Canada. Vancouver is special because you can ski just 15 minutes from the city centre. 
There used to be many trains going from Vancouver to other parts of the country, but now there are only three a week. But the trip is still fun! You can sleep on the train, and you get to see very beautiful scenery at night.

'Zoos have been around for over 3,000 years. A long time ago, the rulers of China had a big zoo called the Gardens of Intelligence. In the past, animals in zoos were taught to do tricks for visitors. But now, we think it's more important to let animals be themselves. Today, many cities have a zoo or a wildlife park. Some people like zoos because they can learn about animals and see them up close. This wouldn't be possible without zoos. However, some people don't like zoos because they think it's wrong to keep animals in cages. They also think that if zoos are not taken care of well, animals might be unhappy and eat the wrong food.'

I play the trumpet in my school jazz band. We had a competition with other schools and we won! Everyone wore different costumes, like our black uniforms or colorful T-shirts. We didn't look like professional bands, but we're used to playing in competitions, so we played well. Some players even made up new songs on stage. It was fun to watch, but even better when my band played!
Not everyone can join our jazz band, but those who want to play come to practice before school and after school. We listen to jazz and learn about it. We also go to special jazz camps during the summer. Grown-ups are surprised that young people like jazz. My music teacher thinks it's because pop music isn't challenging enough. I like jazz because it's new and old at the same time. You can make your own music, but you also feel like you're part of a big tradition. My school is lucky to have great teachers and supportive parents. Without them, we wouldn't be able to do what we love.

'It can rain in Marrakesh, Morocco between November and March. But it doesn't happen often. When it does, the streets can get flooded. This is because the city's pipes can't handle the water. Many winters have been dry lately, so when it rains, people are happy. Marrakesh has parks and gardens because of special underground channels. These channels bring water from the mountains all year round. This is why Marrakesh is not a desert. If you go further south, you'll reach Skoura. There, people make small squares with water channels to grow food. The Atlas mountains are very pretty in the winter with snow.'

Gareth Ellis is 13 years old. His parents, Alan and Kath, are his family. Alan is an engineer and Kath is a nursery teacher. Gareth's older brothers work in a bank and with computers. But Gareth wants to be a clown. Three years ago, his family joined a circus. People are surprised when they hear this, but it's true. Gareth has always wanted to be a clown. When Alan lost his job, they decided to find work at the circus. They both got jobs and Gareth started training to be a clown. He calls himself Bippo. They travel with the circus in the summer and go back home in the winter. Gareth's brothers take care of the house while they are away. It was hard for Kath to leave their big house and small caravan, but it's okay. Gareth misses his long baths, but he likes being a clown. People ask about his school, but he still learns with teachers who travel with the circus. He uses a computer and keeps up with his schoolwork. Kath is happy that Gareth is learning to be a clown. Gareth wants to be the main clown in a circus one day, maybe in Bippo's circus.

Eight-eighteen News is a news agency for young people. The members are between 8 and 18 years old. We collect news and write reports, stories, and articles. We send them to newspapers, magazines, TV, radio, and websites. You can read or listen to the news stories and articles on our website.
We have three centers in the country where you can meet other members and work on projects. We want to open more centers soon. Since we started in 1994, over 2,500 young people have joined us. Sophie was one of them. She says: "I joined Eight-eighteen because they interviewed me for an article. I was amazed by the opportunities they had. I could write my own stories. I was happy to be a member until I was 18. Eight-eighteen helped me a lot. I learned many skills and got a job at 19."
You can join Eight-eighteen and be trained. You will meet with other members once a month to decide who will write each news story. We share skills with each other. Some members are "peer trainers" who teach new members. They are at least 12 years old. As they get more experience, they teach other young people and adults outside of Eight-eighteen. We have training sessions for new members three times a year. Our next session will be in February. If you want to join, call Director Den Ley at 01622 657874 for more information. You can join Eight-eighteen if you can read and write a little. Membership is free and there is no test.

Welcome to Antarctica Sightseeing Flights! Here's what you need to know before booking a flight.
We take tourists on a special plane from Sydney, Australia to see Antarctica and back. The flight is 12 hours long. We usually see ice and icebergs after four hours. We spend four hours flying over Antarctica and then head back.
On the way, experts who have lived in Antarctica will talk to us about the environment and history. You can also ask them questions. You'll have a special camera to see what the pilot sees from take-off to landing.
When we're in the air, you'll get to move to different seats to see the sights from different angles. You might even get a window seat! While we're over Antarctica, you're encouraged to get up and walk around to see the amazing views.
What if the weather is bad? We have special plans to make sure we can still see the best views. Can I see penguins and other animals? Unfortunately, we're too high up to see them clearly. But you can take a boat tour to see them up close.
Can I take photos? Yes, you can! All cameras are welcome. We even have fun activities where you can try on Antarctic clothes.

Little Chefs is a cooking class for kids between 10 and 15 years old. They go to class on Saturdays and learn how to cook. The classes are very popular, and 30 kids are waiting to join. Parents pay £280 for the course. The kids have fun and learn to make yummy food.
One of the kids, Bill, is 10 years old. He loves his mom's cooking and now he can make it better than her. The teachers make the kids laugh, especially when they eat the food they made.
Flora is 12 years old. She loves cooking and made a meal for her friends. She was a little scared to try cooking at first, but now she's glad she did. The teacher, Philippe, says that kids are great at learning and remembering things, but they can make a mess in the kitchen! If parents teach their kids to cook when they're young, they'll be able to cook for themselves when they grow up.

Driving in the Winter
Winter driving can be tricky. You can't always predict what will happen, and accidents can happen quickly. Fog can suddenly appear over a hill, and ice can be hidden under the snow, waiting to make you lose control of your car. Another car might slide across the road in front of you.
To drive safely on icy roads, remember two important rules. First, drive smoothly. Don't make sudden movements, like turning the wheel or hitting the brakes. This can make your car hard to control. Imagine you have a cup of hot coffee next to you - drive carefully so you don't spill it.
Second, pay attention to what might happen. On icy roads, you need to look far ahead and be prepared to stop. Test how long it takes to stop by slowing down gently. Remember, you might be going faster than you think. When the road is wet, snowy, or icy, leave more space between you and the car in front of you. Try to stay in control of your car, and you'll be safe.

Craigie Aitchison was a Scottish painter. He went to London to study law, but he decided to study art instead. He found it hard to learn traditional drawing skills, but he kept painting. When he was in his late 20s, the Italian government gave him money to study art in Italy. He liked the light and colors of the Italian countryside and wanted to put this in his paintings.
Aitchison paints by putting thin layers of color on top of each other, from light to dark. He doesn't know exactly what the final result will be. He says, "It's a secret because I don't know myself." He doesn't make drawings before starting a painting, because he might get bored and not finish it. Instead, he changes his paintings many times until they are finished.
Aitchison likes to paint people who don't want to see their pictures while he's painting. If they ask to see the painting, he can't focus. He doesn't follow any specific style or tradition in his painting. He just paints the way he feels like painting. Despite this, his work still inspires young British painters.

'Two years ago, my 14-year-old son Ben asked for a drum set for his birthday. We were worried about the noise at first. 'Why do you want drums?' we asked. Ben said, 'It's better than watching TV or playing video games. It'll keep me out of trouble.' We agreed, but said, 'You have to think about the rest of the family and our neighbours when you play.' That was the start. Ben's friends started coming over with their guitars and other instruments. Now, for several hours a week, our house is loud with music. But it's good for us too - my husband and I go for a walk while they practice. The band is friendly and polite, even if their music is not my favourite. They play at local clubs for young people. Our main worry is that they won't do their schoolwork because of their music. But so far, that hasn't happened. I always remind Ben how important his schoolwork is. One thing is certain - Ben was right: it keeps him out of trouble and he's never bored.'

'Atlantic College I visited Atlantic College in Wales, a special school that helps young people learn and grow. It's different from other schools because it lets students do activities outside the classroom to help them learn. The students, aged 16 to 18, come from many countries. They study in the morning and then do something useful in the afternoon, like helping on a farm or taking care of people who need help. 
The students come from different backgrounds and countries. Some students can't afford the fees, so the college offers help. About a quarter of the students are from the UK, and some of them get help from the government. 
I like that the college helps people understand each other. As one student said, "You learn to live with people and respect them, even if you don't like them. I didn't argue with my sister as much when I came back home." 
In summary, Atlantic College gives its students a great education and it seems to work well.'

I'm 32 years old and I just finished my first year at university. I have to go to lectures and read books quickly and write long essays. I decided to go to university because I was bored with my job as a secretary. I was earning a good salary, but I didn't like the work. I was jealous of the students at the local university who looked happy and full of hope. Now that I'm a student, it's hard for me to make friends with my younger classmates. They often think I'm a teacher and ask me questions I can't answer. I also feel different from the teachers because I know less than they do. But I'm glad I decided to go to university because it's important to have a good job. I prefer to read books on weekends instead of partying. As a student, I also get discounts for theatre and cinema tickets. Sometimes I worry about what I'll do after university, but I think it was a good decision to go back to school at my age.

Henry Ford was born in Michigan in 1863. He didn't like farming, so he started working as a mechanic when he was 15. In 1893, he built his first car. He drove it for 1,500 kilometers and then sold it. He built two more cars, and in 1903, he started the Ford Motor Company.
Henry Ford wanted to make cars that ordinary people could buy. He used strong and light steel to make his cars cheaper. In 1908, he made the first Ford Model 'T'. It was the first car that many people could afford. It cost $825. Soon, he was selling 100 cars every day!
By 1927, the Ford Motor Company was very successful. Henry Ford's cars were simple and cheap, but sometimes that meant people didn't have many choices. Henry Ford said, "You can have any color you like, as long as it's black."
